name: Methods and Technologies
description: A taxonomy of methods and technologies that may be used to implement AI / ML system tasks and use cases

children.name: Acoustic Triangulation
children.description: A process that determines the distance and/or orientation of an audio signal using multiple sensors placed at different locations.

children.name: Neural Network
children.description: A learning model composed of artificial neurons organized into nonlinear computational circuits

children.name: Transformer
children.description: A neural network that relies on attention mechanisms to build representations.

children.name: Convolutional Neural Network
children.description: A neural network that utilizes convolution operations via learnable filter banks, applied on limited receptive fields of their inputs.

children.name: Recurrent Neural Network
children.description: A class of neural networks used for modeling sequential data, utilizing memory and recursion to capture temporal dynamics emergent in the input.

children.name: Generative Adversarial Network
children.description: A class of neural networks used for data generation, employing generator and discriminator components to produce synthetic data with high fidelity.

children.name: Siamese Network
children.description: A neural network that uses shared weights on dual inputs, to produce output representations that optimize a distance / similarity relation.

children.name: Autoencoder
children.description: A neural network trained to optimize low-dimensional representation bottlenecks with input recostruction objectives.
children.issues: This also can be nested under unsupervised learning

children.name: Computer Vision Methods and Technologies
children.description: Methods and technologies used under the computer vision domain.

children.name: Image Segmentation
children.description: The approach of partitioning an image to semantically contiguous regions

children.name: 3D reconstruction
children.description: The task of computating the 3-dimensional geometric attributes of real objects from partial data.

children.name: Face Detection
children.description: The detection of human faces in visual content.

children.name: Optical Character Recognition
children.description: The use of image processing and computer vision techniques in order to extract text from images, document pdfs and other visual media.

children.name: Satellite Imaging
children.description: The use of imaging satellites for earth observation image data acquisition.

children.name: Natural Language Processing Methods and Technologies
children.description: Methods and technologies commonly utilized for text analysis

children.name: Character NGrams
children.description: The approach of using character-level ngrams to build text representations

children.name: Language Modeling
children.description: The approach of building a statistical model of word co-occurence associations via predicting missing words in a context.

children.name: Keyword Filtering
children.description: Methods of statically restricting keywords from participating in input / output sets of a task.

children.name: Audio Analysis Methods and Technologies
children.description: Methods and technologies utilized in audio analysis systems

children.name: Automatic Speech Recognition
children.description: The process of automatically transcribing human speech from audio.

children.name: Speaker Diarization
children.description: The approach of identifying separate speakers from conversations in input audio.

children.name: Acoustic Fingerprint
children.description: The generation of short summaries from audio signals for rapid retrieval and recognition.

children.name: Machine Learning Methods
children.description: Broad methods and techniques used for ML model building

children.name: Ensemble Aggregation
children.description: Approaches where outputs of multiple (distinct and individual) learners are collectively considered (e.g. via aggregation, fusion, voting, pooling ,etc.) to produce a final prediction.

children.name: Intermmediate modeling
children.description: The approach where a learning system cannot directly use data X to obtain the target solution Y due to existing limitations. Instead, the system works around it by solving distinct related tasks such that a path to Y is reached, e.g.  X-> A ->  [...] B -> Y .

children.name: Distributional Learning
children.description: An approach of arriving at representations (usually vectorial embeddings) of objects from unlabelled data via analyzing its co-occurence distributions.

children.name: Multimodal Learning
children.description: The paradigm where multiple data modalities (e.g. text, audio, images) are utilized for learning and problem-solving.

children.name: Other domain-specific methods
children.description: Popular methods mostly relevant to specific domains

children.name: Geolocation
children.description: Estimation of the geographic position of objects of interest.
children.issues: Is this technical enough? Compare/contrast it to 'clustering'.

children.name: Conceptual Data Handling
children.description: The use of conceptual / categorical data as learning inputs, rather than numeric or primitive (e.g. image, audio, text, etc.).
children.issues: A better label is something to emphasize the diversity / unevenness of the data

children.name: Unsupervised Learning
children.description: The approach of modeling data patterns and structure without usage of ground truth.

children.name: Clustering
children.description: The unsupervised task of grouping data instances into groups with high internal similarity and low similarity across different groups.

children.name: Generation
children.description: The task of generating data from existing background knowledge, context and/or prompts.
children.issue: Deprecate; tasks such as 'text generation' exist

children.name: Collaborative Filtering
children.description: Methods where user representations are built from attributes, history, activity, etc. and utilized for producing recommendations based on preferences of similar users.

children.name: Content-based Filtering
children.description: Approaches that generate recommendations by focusing on data item content, properties and metadata rather than user-oriented attributes.

children.name: Supervised Learning
children.description: Learning methods facilitating training with ground truth.

children.name: Regression
children.description: The task of annotating data with real-valued predictions.

children.name: Classification
children.description: The task of annotating data to one or more semantic labels from a given labelset.

children.name: Sequential Analysis
children.description: The task of producing predictions based on a history of multiple data points
